alert.note: Alert for Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 1:58PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Costilla County through 230 PM MDT... At 156 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of San Luis, or 17 miles southwest of Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause ponding of water on roadways and localized minor flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Costilla County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft
